alert.note: Alert for Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains; Pickens Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pickens and northeastern Oconee Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 807 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Walhalla, or near Lake Keowee, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salem, Devils Fork State Park, Lake Keowee, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Lake Jocassee, Bad Creek, Nine Times, Sunset and Rocky Bottom. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains; Pickens Mountains
